characters: INT. SUBWAY TRAIN- VERY EARLY MORNING

dialogues.speaker: INT. SUBWAY TRAIN- VERY EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: CLOSE on SIMON JAMES. His eyes are closed. It is difficul to tell whether he is asleep or not. We hear a voice off screen.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You're in my place. SIMON opens his eyes. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You're in my place. SIMON looks around the carriage. It is almost completely EMPTY. He looks back at the MAN quizzically. The MAN stares at SIMON in a hostile manner. Perplexed, SIMON gets up and stands by a hand rail. The M takes SIMON’S place, folds,out a newspaper and starts to read. SIMON looks at the MAN who, from behind his paper, raises his middle finger at SIMON. SIMON looks at his reflection in the glass window of the SUBWAY train. He looks ghostly and half-formed. SIMON is in his late-twenties to mid-thirties. He is of average height and build. His hair color and clothing are unremarkable. Although he is handsome, he is not overly s In“short, “he is a thoroughly average man. The title appears over Simon’s face, so forlorn it almost makes you want to cry. “THE DOUBLE.” The train stops and the door opens. A crowd of people spills in, pushing Simon back. He fight against the flow to try to get out. Several people bump directly into Simon without so much as a word of apology.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (being pushed) Sorry. Simon waits for the others to get on the train. His path finally clear, he attempts to leave again. As he steps forward one last person jumps onto the train bumping him to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. The person doesn’t even acknowledge Simon. There is a beep and Simon has to leap forward, barely making it out through the sliding doors. As the train departs, we see SIMON getting smaller and smaller on the EMPTY PLATFORM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in New York, or some comparable metropolis. Though everything is familiar the world is somewhat off, somewha strange. Simon walks down a MOSTLY EMPTY street, keeping his eyes lowered. There are huge buildings on either side of him. Any other people on the street are walking in the other direction and Simon has to dodge them to avoid collisions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON waits outside AN ENORMOUS OFFICE, BUILDING. It’s relatively deserted. TIME PASSES and a few people, come and go. Eventually, SIMON spots. a woman, HANNAH, approaching the LOBBY of the building. SIMON smiles, then composes himsel and skips after. her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon enters the lobby of the office building. A few step ahead we see HANNAH. She is using a card to swipe through barrier. Hannah is Simon’s age. She is a little unkempt, but very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Hannah, are you going to... Simon smiles and quickens his pace a bit. He takes out hi card, and swipes through, but the barrier doesn’t move. A GUARD sitting behind a large marble desk calls out to Simon just as Hannah begins to turn around.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: You, hey. Simon turns and looks at the guard, surprised to be singl out. He looks a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: All visitors have to sign in. Simon moves to the desk where he takes a pen.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: My card’s not working for some reason.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: All visitors have to sign in.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I work here. I have a card. My name is Simon James - you don’t recognise me? He sees Hannah getting into an elevator and watches=the door close. Simon frowns and signs the sheet. His is the first name. He is given a DAY PASS that says ‘SIMON AMES - TEMPORARY VISITOR’. SIMON .(CONT’D) Oh, sorry. My name is Simon James. Not Simon,Ames... Simon trails off as he sees that the guard is no longer paying attention to him. INT. ELEVATOR — EARLY MORNING Simon rides up an enormous elevator. The biggest elevator you have ever seen. We watch Simon from above as he STANDS ALONE in the middl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sits at his cubicle in the middle of an enormous office space. The place is separated into hundreds of cubicles. SIMON is the first person there. His desk and cubicle are just slightly too small for him. Every cubicle has the same computer. The computers are enormous, taking up half of the cubicle space. They are box-y and make loud whirring noises that fi11 the office. The office has no windows other than wall made of tinted glass.  4. Simon sits down at his desk, adjusting himself in his too small chair. He looks at a stack of paper and frowns a little. A few people enter the office dressed as Simon is, with a white shirt and tie. Simon looks up and greets them with his slight, hesitant voice, but none of them acknowledge him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the cubicles are now full with office workers. Everyo is much, much older than Simon. Simon sits at his desk, copying a hand-written page onto his computer. The pages are all questionnaires: long survey-like documents of various people, filled with categories like ‘profession", ‘marital status’, ‘personal habits’, ‘interests’ etc Simon finishes up the page he is copying and moves,to the next page. He has nearly completed copying an, enormous batch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon stares off into the distance. He occasionally pecks something out on his keyboard. Across the room we see MR. PAPADOPOULOS, an extraordinari round man. He has thick eyebrows and his brown suit indicates that he is in management.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: That’s right, that’s great. Making the big push! Simon jumps up and approaches Mr. Papadopoulos. He fixes his hair and grabs the stack of papers he has just completed “copying. Papadopoulos talks to everyone and no one at all as he weaves his way through the maze of cubicles. PAPADOPOULOS (CONT’D) Excellent work everyone. We've got to work double-time now, making the big push. We watch from above as Simon, carrying his stack of paper triangulates his way through the cubicles to cut off Mr. Papadopoulos.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Umm, Mr. Papadopoulos?

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: Yes, what’s that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you I finished up. I’ve done the first...

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: Excellent job! (he takes the stack of paper from Simon) That's the type of initiative we need. I’1l tell the colonel right away. How long have you been here, son? Just started, eh?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (frowning) Seven years, sir.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: Ah, of course. (slaps his head with realization) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (confused) You're welcome, sir. (beat) Actually, I have some rather exciting ideas I‘4ve been wanting to share with the colonel about what we could do with the computers, things that would make the reports much more powerful, and efficient and...

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: Very interesting, I must say. (pauses ) Come with me. Simon follows Papadopoulos. He seems a bit startled and excited, he might get his chance to discuss his ideas. PAPADOPOULOS (CONT’D) My daughter’s name is Melanie.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (confused) A nice name. Papadopoulos has now stopped at a strange office behind t tinted glass. The door says, “The Colonel’s Quarters. Executive Offices.”

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: She's interning for the holidays.  6. MELANIE is sixteen years old. She smacks her gum, has her foot up on the desk and is painting her toenails. PAPADOPOULOS (CONT’D) Say hello, Melanie. Melanie doesn’t even look at Simon.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (confused) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: Stanley here’s going to be your mentor. Simon nods along happily for a moment, then looks at Papadopoulos.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: An hour a day... at your discretion. (beat, quietly to Simon) She's a good girl, but no head for figures. With that Papadopoulos enters the strange office.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Idiot. (to SIMON) You can go now. Simon remains, looking confused.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yes, I do have to be going, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Because if I were to find out how depressingly meaningless what you do actually is I might be forced to feel sorry for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon searches his wallet for a dollar. He can only find five. He uses the change machine and picks up the heavy load of quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sips his coffee and stares blankly ahead. He sees a POSTER on the notice board that says, ‘THE COLONEL’S BALL. DRINKS, DANCING, ENJOYMENT. ATTENDANCE MANDATORY. ’ Harris enters the room. He looks through his wallet for a moment before turning to talk to Simon.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: You finished your report yet?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Just a little while ago.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: You think you could help me out on mine?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I did the entire thing last time.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: I know. I still have the inspiration, it’s just my powers of concentration seem to have waned.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (shaking, head) Just leave it on my desk. I’1l get to it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Do you have any money? SIMON sighs and gives HARRIS some coins for the machine. makes a coffee.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiling) Fantastic. (hesitates, not much to say) Uh, what else is going on? SIMON SHRUGS.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You going to the Colonel’s Ball?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: It’s mandatory.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Some drunk girl’s gonna get it.  There’s a pause.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON stands with a large stack of paper under his arm. INT. PHOTOCOPYING DEPT. SIMON waits at the counter. He sees HANNAH approach. Hannah's face is hard to read and she doesn’t give out to many visual clues. She’s different than the rest of Simon coworkers, but inscrutable.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Hi. Can I get these copied please?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (not unkindly) I did these for you yesterday, didn’t I?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Well, it was something... A TELEPHONE RINGS. HANNAH steps away to answer.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Sorry. A MEAN-LOOKING woman, LIZ, TAKES her place.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you just print out two copies?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t use this department for just one copy. She takes the papers.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the last time. SIMON watches HANNAH talk on the phone as we hear the rumble of PHOTOCOPIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Hannah. Can you stay late? I’ve got to get this lump checked out. HANNAH looks over and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sits alone at a circular table in the middle of an enormous cafeteria. People sit together at tables all around him, while Simon barely touches his food and reads a book. Simon looks up from the book and sees Hannah also sitting alone at a nearby table. HARRIS sidles up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: You hit it yet?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: That chick, Hannah, you banged her yet?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I'm just trying...

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: That’s the spirit!

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (frowning) No! I’ve barely talked to her...

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Make a move at the Colonel’s Ball. Those things end up like Roman orgies.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: She doesn’t strike me as the type to go.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: It’s mandatory. Everyone has to go.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Not everyone goes.  10.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: She's pretty good looking, but as long as you don’t talk much and she’s wasted... They sit in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, I just realised: ‘Colonel's Ball’ sounds funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sits at his desk. He looks very tired. He is talkin on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes, mother. I’ll be there. I’m just working a bit late. THE OFFICE is empty. HARRIS enters.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Goodbye, then.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS,
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Hey - watch this. HARRIS climbs up onto one of the desks and manages to jum across all the cubicles till he’s by the door on the othe side of the room. He bows and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon stands across the street from his office building, not many people are around. Hannah exits the building alone. Simon slinks back into t shadows and watches her go. He sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sits in an uncomfortable looking chair, opposite hi MOTHER. Simon’s Mother is not particularly old, but she has cloud eyes and a generally vacant expression. In the distance we see other residents watching a dated game show. All the furniture seems a bit strange.  11. Closer is a tiny old lady of unclear ethnicity, perhaps a GYPSY WOMAN. She is bundled up and seems to be staring at Simon. Simon glances at her occasionally, looking uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Things are going very well for me at work, you'll be happy to know. I expect to speak with The Colonel about some plans I’ve been working on. You wouldn’t believe what these computers are capable of. I really think they’re going to change things.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (a bit angry) What are you going on about? Simon continues as though he’s used to this.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: There’s also a girl that I’m interested in, and well, it’s been going slowly, but I think something might be about to happen.

dialogues.speaker: GYPSY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Your mother says you are a strange boy.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Srange? No. Well, she’s never been particularly warm, and sometimes she gets confused.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (forceful) You'll never catch a female using that puny worm as bait. Simon’s mother reaches for his lap but he uncomfortably pushes her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Though she does have her moments of lucidity.

dialogues.speaker: GYPSY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Let me see your hand.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: No, thanks I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: GYPSY WOMAN
dialogues.text: You're not right.  12. Simon looks a little concerned, but a man from the STAFF approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: May I speak with you?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yes. (to Gypsy) Excuse me. Simon walks a few steps away to speak with the man.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: There seems to be a discrepancy in your bill.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yes, well, there was a rather large cost increase, and no explanation, so I thought it might be a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: There’s a new price.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: And why is that?

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: Improvements. Simon looks around at the obviously unchanged room.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: But that seems a little...

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: Would you like your mother to rot on the street?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (thinks a second) No.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: Good. That’s settled. Simon seems about to say something, but shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: She doesn’t seem quite as well.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: (already hurrying away ) It’s because she’s old.  13. Simon sighs and looks back at his mother. The gypsy woman stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon walks home through an enormous complex of tall apartment buildings. They look so alike you can’t tell th difference between any of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sifts through the dumpster behind an apartment building. Above is a shoot from which the trash comes. A black bag drops down as Simon looks through the debris. Simon has several scraps of paper in his hand but is stil searching. He finally finds another scrap of paper and greedily grab it. He steps down from the dumpster and is embarrassed to see JANITOR watching him.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be doing that. SIMON. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon hurries across the courtyard to the apartment directly across from the building the dumpster was attach to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON hurries up the stairs, almost running into an old woman on his way up. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT. Simon enters his apartment and quickly walks to the windo turning on a small floor lamp. His apartment is very sparse and small; a bookshelf, desk and a small television. There are few pictures on the wal and his bed sits on the floor. It is meticulously clean, the product of a very ordered personality. Simon looks out the window to the hundreds of apartments the building across from him. Simon reaches up and lifts the window open as wide as it can go. The wind pours through the apartment and Simon leans out, looking into the great distance below.  14. He takes his jacket off and looks into a rather large telescope. It is trained on the apartment opposite his. Hannah stands at a drafting table where she see draws a face. Her apartment is colorful and cozy, but there is something of the same feeling of loneliness in her room a well. She is concentrated fully, biting her lip. She looks charming. She steps back from the drawing and we see it i Liz; the mean person she works with. It is very well done She is unhappy with the drawing, though, and tears it up, tossing it down the trash chute. On her wall are a handful of completed drawings, presumab of other faces from the office. Hannah has let her hair down. She looks very comfortable and walks to the window where she languidly stretches. We see a hint of her bare midriff. She then walks to her couch and lays back, yawning deeply In his apartment Simon reaches for a simple chair and remains watching Hannah. Simon takes the pieces of paper he collected from the tra and puts them on the floor,;,.working to piece them toget We see that it is another of Hannah’s drawings, an earlie draft of LIZ - but still very accomplished. Simon looks up from the floor and returns to the telescop He sees his reflection in the glass, hollow and ghostly.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you? HANNAH gets up and leaves the room. SIMON waits for a whi before allowing himself to tilt the telescope and survey Aeman watching a commercial. A beautiful woman brushing her hair in the mirror. Someone with his back to us peeing in the bathroom. Simon moves the telescope to the apartment above Hannah's and we see a MAN dressed very formally in a tuxedo starin directly at Simon with his own pair of binoculars. The ma has a piece of paper pinned to his lapel. He is holding a bloody handkerchief to the side of his head. Simon takes a step back in shock and embarrassment before looking through the telescope again. The man is still there, staring at Simon through his binoculars. The man waves at Simon.  15. He looks exactly the same as the man who told Simon out of his place n the Subway. Simon hesitantly raises his hand in reply. The man steps on the ledge of his window. The man, now steadied on the window, again waves at The man dramatically leaps from the window. The man to fall and fall. We never see him land. Simon gasps and jumps up. He still has his hand up response to the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashing of police lights fills the courtyard. voices in the background. to move Simon. seems in We hear Simon leans against the side of the building, within the area cordoned off by the police. Two police officers are carefully carrying a body, alread enclosed within a bag, dowm.a ladder. The body had on a hard veranda. landed A FAT DETECTIVE.is Sipping on a cup of coffee and writing notes as he talks to Simon. A FEMALE DETECTIVE looks over his shoulders as he writes.

dialogues.speaker: FAT DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: And then what did you do?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I called the police.

dialogues.speaker: FAT DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Right. (beat) Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: He waved at me.

dialogues.speaker: FAT DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: (seeming momentarily interested) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Right before he jumped. He waved.  16.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: How'd he wave? Simon makes a waving motion, looks embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: FAT DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Did you wave back? Simon doesn’t say anything for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I wonder why he did it?

dialogues.speaker: FAT DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: His note said he was lonely. Should of got a dog.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Or exercised more. That’s important.

dialogues.speaker: FAT DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Should I write that down?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Maybe, in parenthesis. Simon shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Did he suffer?

dialogues.speaker: FAT DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Splat. Simon grimaces. Two paramedics are loading preparing to load the body into an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Do you see this sort of thing often?

dialogues.speaker: FAT DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Every day. That’s what we do, suicides.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Only suicides?

dialogues.speaker: FAT DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: For the whole city? The detective looks at him like he’s crazy  17.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: We can barely cover the neighborhood. (beat) You know, the funny thing is he would have landed on the awning if he’d just jumped a few feet to the right. Probably survived if we'd gotten here quick enough. Horribly maimed of course, but still.

dialogues.speaker: FAT DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: If you can get them to the hospital quickly enough to stop the brain swelling.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: That’s true. We see Hannah a few feet away. Her hair is down and»wshe hastily dressed. The detectives walks off to check on something and Simon watches them. Simon walks up to Hannah. SIMON. Hannah? HANNAH looks at.Simon, somewhat dazed.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s Simon. I work in the same office as you. I often photocopy things...

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: The man that jumped. I was the one who saw him.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I live in that building.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: He lived above me. My neighbor told me about it. (beat) I didn’t know him.  18.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: He waved at me.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) Strange. As they watch the police work with moving the body. Hanna cringes and grabs Simon by the arm. Simon talks loud, as though he is resolved.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: It’s the Colonel’s Ball tomorrow. (beat) Do you think you'll go?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: It’s mandatory. They stand in silence for a moment. HANNAH turns to leave Simon shouts after her.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Yes? SIMON. It’s terrible to,be alone too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and Hannah sit opposite one another in the booth of an ancient looking diner.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yes. So, I’ve been working on a thing to do with regression analysis. Like, in my spare time. I’m pretty happy with it. I’m hoping to show it to the Colonel when it’s ready. I mean, you wouldn’t believe what these computers are capable of. I really think they’re going to change things.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (neutral) I don’t really understand computers. They are quiet and a WAITRESS comes and drops off their drinks.  19. Hannah has tea in front of her while Simon has some blue soda. Simon looks a little confused.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (Calling after the waitress) Erm, I ordered orange juice... No reply.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I suppose this is just as good. They sit quietly for a few moments. Hannah and Simon turn to a nearby television which is playing an odd futuristic sci-fi/noir movie. Simon looks down at the table. Hannah’s wrist is near his hand. It is fine and fragile, her hand is stained with pencil smudges. He slowly moves his hand forward. Hannah turns to look at Simon and he quickly averts his eyes back to the television show.

dialogues.speaker: SCI-FI DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: (on the TV, dramatic) There’s no such thing as... second chances.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I like this show. Hannah smiles at Simon. He finds it hard to read her expression. They return back to the screen for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you draw?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: (looking suspicious) Why?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: It’s just your hand. Hannah looks down and rubs the pencil marks from her hand We hear a PHONE in the background.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: It’s from the printer.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Because it’s cool if you do, I like...

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: You've got a call.  20.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: It’s not for me.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Frumpy looking guy named Simon.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (hesitates) That’s me. (to Hannah) Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon quickly grabs for the pay phone. He tries to look around the corridor into the restaurant but just barely can’t see where Hannah is sitting.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mom? (beat) Yes, but it’s just a night terror. (beat) No that didn’t ever happen. (beat) I know I’m a disappointment. (beat) I have to go, I’m with a girl. (beat) Yes, a female girl. (beat, sighs) I don’t know if she’s fertile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon stands at the table, but Hannah is now gone. Her te is-only partially finished. He picks up a note, it reads, “Sorry, had to go. Maybe se you at the Colonel’s ball - Hannah.” Simon looks both discouraged and excited. He lifts his ey once again to the silly show on the television. It goes t a commercial break and we cut to an image of an enormous pile of papers, taller than a man.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OVER
dialogues.text: Think of what your business could do if it had a giant, electronic brain. The stack explodes and the sheets of paper begin to fall, tumbling one after another to reveal an enormous computer A MAN is under it, typing away, smoking a cigar  21. This is THE COLONEL, a European-looking MAN in his 60s/70 dressed like a member of the British Royal Family. VOICE OVER (CONT’D) Well now it has. Meet the Colonel. The Colonel walks through an enormous room of attractive women clacking away at computers. VOICE OVER (CONT’D) For years, the Colonel has provided your business with the most detailed personal profiling on the market. Using his powerful super computers to provide all the information you need to know exactly who your target consumer is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We reveal that Simon, Melanie and Harris*watch an ORIENTATION VIDEO.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: (whisper) Did she say anything else?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (whisper) No. Just,that she was definitely going.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: You should have stroked her earlobe.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: This is colossally boring. Simon and Harris return their attention to the video.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OVER
dialogues.text: The Colonel will go to any lengths to find everything about anybody. We see a montage of data collection. In each shot, The Colonel is Co-ordinating. Men in overcoats conducting bubble tests: taking notes at what someone buys at a drugstore; looking through someone’s trash.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: It’s actually quite exciting, the new technology is incredibly powerful. Right now we’re using a scattershot approach, but... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve been meaning to talk to your father and the Colonel about this... using simple regression analysis and honing in on a few key signals we can use these machines to find out anything we need incredibly quickly. We could really reconfigure the entire business. (beat) You know, I really think computers are going to change things. Both Melanie and Harris look at Simon as though he’s craz We return to the video. THE COLONEL is shaking hands with various people next to one of his enormous computers

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OVER
dialogues.text: Governments, corporations, foreign nationals... The Colonel can service all your needs.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Are you touching my earlobe? We return to see Harris, reaching his hand behind Simon's head, limply holding Melanie’s earlobe.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Yes; I am.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Harris: that’s not appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: I’m going to leave now. (beat, to Simon) And, you're pathetic. She’s got to be at the ball, it’s mandatory.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Does that mean you’ll be there?

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: I’m underage, you sack of shit.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Don’t fight it. She gets up and leaves.  23.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: (to SIMON) I just hope I’m not so upset that I tell my Dad about this.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (turning to HARRIS) What are you doing? You shouldn't even be here. He leaves. We see the projection screen.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OVER
dialogues.text: Because The Colonel knows there are no special people

dialogues.speaker: THE COLONEL
dialogues.text: (straight to camera, with a slight Russian accent) Just people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON stuffs his work clothes into a bag. He is wearing a tuxedo. He looks in the mirror and practices introduction

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Oh - hi Hannah.,Hannah! Hi. Hannah? Hey. Simon. From the scene of the suicide! Etc. INT. OFFICE —, EVENING Again, Simon is the last one there. He dumps his bag underneath his desk. He looks around tentatively, then steps up onto his desk to repeat the trick Harris did. Bu as soon as he sets foot on another desk an alarm sounds. He looks around in panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sits opposite someone who is typing up a report on him.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What are you writing?

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR ONE
dialogues.text: Don’t make this worse for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I’ve never done anything like that before.  24.

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR TWO
dialogues.text: Card please. SIMON hands over his identity card. The PERSON puts it in a card reader and keys something in.

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR ONE
dialogues.text: This card's corrupted. You'll get a replacement in six to eight weeks. INVESTIGATOR ONE cuts it up.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: How will I get in and out of the building?

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR TWO
dialogues.text: The card replacement fee will be deducted from your wages. INT. LOBBY OF COLONEL’S BALL VENUE - EVENING A large door, like that of an AMBASSADORIAL BUILDING. Simon stands in the lobby, next to a MAN with a clipboard Behind him a WOMAN is looking something up on a computer. Simon has clearly been waiting a long time. GUESTS in evening wear arrive and enter the building. We hear a band play in the background.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Why does no one else need to swipe in?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: We carry out these checks at random. If you’re suggesting you're being persecuted, you’1l need to fill out this form. He hands Simon a form which is headed ‘YOU HAVE THE RIGHT NOT TO BE PERSECUTED’. HARRIS appears.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: See you in there.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: See? He knows I work here. Harris! Tell him who I am.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen that man before in my life! And he disappears.  25.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: He’s being a dick... The man looks sternly at Simon for swearing.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -a silly person. I had my card confiscated-

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Because it was corrupted.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (calling out) I can’t find him on the list!

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: She can’t find you on the list.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Everyone is on the list. I’ve worked here for seven years.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Please step away.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I work here. Why would I try to break in to something that’s mandatory? It’s a job requirement.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Are you planning to use force?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Do you know what mandatory means? No one wants to go to this. We hear joyous cheers from within.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Please step away. EXT. COLONEL’S BALL VENUE - MOMENTS LATER Simon wanders around in disbelief. He tries to see what’s going on inside, but the angle is too steep. EXT. SERVICE ENTRANCE COLONEL’S BALL VENUE - MOMENTS LATE Simon creeps in through the kitchens. A couple of staff members look at him suspiciously. Simon stops and looks around and pretends that he’s inspecting the premises.  26.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Very good. Excellent. I’1l be telling the Colonel about the great work you're all doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON, crouched down peers through a crack in the door. W see his POV of a grand ballroom. People are milling about eating canapes, chatting, laughing and dancing to the mus played by a band. The band are impossibly old. A WAITER swooshes by, leaving SIMON exposed in an odd posture. He walks forward in a crouched manner and tries to casually segue into standing up and walking properly. A few people notice him, but he’s largely ignored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON picks up a drink and some hors d’oeuvres. He looks a long table full of strange raffle prizes. The band play a fanfare and people shuffle «to attention. Mr. Papadapolous takes to the stage and stands on a pre- prepared box.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOLOUS
dialogues.text: And now we take a brief break in our revelry to honour our Young Employee of the,Year. And to present the award is» last year’s winner, Mr. Stevens. Fanfare. Mr Steven’s approaches: he looks between fifty a sixty. PAPADOPOLOUS gets down off the box and picks it up

dialogues.speaker: MR. STEVENS
dialogues.text: And the winner is... He ‘produces an envelope from his pocket. Papadapolous co over to help him, as Mr. Stevens has a prosthetic hand an finds it difficult to open it. The band’s drum roll start to» become frighteningly long. MR. STEVENS (CONT’D) Mr. Harris. We he hear a whoop of delight from HARRIS - a spotlight finds him. We have audience applause. We see Simon, unable to believe his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon wanders through a series of rooms, looking for Hannah.  27. Various people enjoying themselves. Papadopolous is doing vaguely racist impression of someone, to the delight of some business colleagues. He sees Hannah sitting at the other end of a room. She’s a fifties-style ball gown and is smoking a cigarette. Sim watches her for a while. She looks a bit bored, alone, seemingly ready for someone to approach her. Time seems to stand still. The song played by the band sounds epic and romantic. Just as she looks up and returns his gaze, two men grab Simon and start dragging him out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You're not meant to be here.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What do you mean? I work here. SIMON looks mortified. He gazes at Hannah, «who looks confused, but not particularly concerneds)More and more people at the dance start looking around. The band stops playing.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re making a mistake. I work here. I work here! He tries to shrug them off.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s no need to drag me. They simply re-double their aggression - the struggle becomes; more undignified. A few steps away we see The Colonel. He listens to someon speaking, nodding with a benign, patrician air. He turns look at Simon. Someone whispers in the Colonel’s ear. Sim looks up: this is the first time he has seen this figure the flesh. EXT. COLONEL’S BALL VENUE SIMON is thrown down the steps and onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: The appropriate amendments will be made to your record. Simon gets up. He is visibly shaken. Behind the doors we can just make out the sound of the band and see some movement in the hall. Simon staggers about for a bit. He is frustrated, pacing back and forth, seeming almost like he’s going to cry.  28. Simon starts to punch at the air and flail. Completely letting go.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with them? I’ma person, like other people. What’s wrong with you?! It gives the Colonel the complete wrong idea about me. I have things to say to him. Ideas that he’d very much like to hear, I’m sure. Simon pushes the glass door several times causing it to clatter as he continues to yell. Finally he kicks the door which gives a shiver, but the only real result is a sharp pain in his foot. Simon begins to curse to himself loudly. The door swings open and the security man again looks sternly at Simon who continues to curse.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Did you want something? Simon looks as though he’s about to say something, really let the man have it, but as he clutches his foot he finds himself saying

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Nothing, -I don’t want anything. The man stares at Simon, the party still going on in the background. The man turns and the door slowly draws to a close. As ‘the door is closing we see a MAN not too far away in conversation. He turns around and we only catch a glimpse of him, but he looks exactly the same as Simon. The door clatters shut as Simon tries desperately to see. Simon seems to go limp with horror. He slumps against the wall as though faint, lowering his head, apart from himse and lost in a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon stands on a deserted bridge overlooking a great dea of traffic. He stares down. There is a strange feel in th air. We're not quite sure where we are and things seem a bit off, almost as though Simon is not in control of himself. A long shadow appears, followed by the clip clop of feet.  29. A figure starts walking towards us. Simon doesn’t look up until the figure passes him. The man glances back. Again, incredibly, he has the same face as Simon! After he recovers from shock. Simon starts to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON follows the man through various streets. The man is walking so quickly that Simon can barely keep up. EXT. SIMON’S APARTMENT BLOCK - NIGHT The man reaches Simon’s apartment block and, without looking back, skips into HANNAH’s block of flats. SIMON rushes up to his apartment. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS Simon runs to the telescope and starts scouring the vario rooms to see if he can see where his double is. Something draws him to the flat above Hannah's. He sees a door open and light pour in from the corridor. The main light is switched on. The figure walks to the window and stares almost straight at Simon before drawing the blinds. Although very distant, the face bears a striking resemblance to Simon’s.

dialogues.speaker: THREE
dialogues.text: INT. SIMON’'S APARTMENT - MORNING Simon wakes up with a start. He is still wearing his dinn jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon - looking a bit tired and rumpled - is signing in just as Hannah passes. This time he manages to get into t elevator with her. INT. ELEVATOR —- MORNING Simon stands awkwardly at some considerable distance from Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: There was a bit of a mix up at the ball last night. Unfortunate.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I’m going down.  30.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I don’t mind going down. SIMON winces to himself.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then up. An awkward rest of elevator ride. Hannah says ‘bye’ and exits. The doors close and the elevator starts to travel back up. In frustration, Simon kicks the wall. The elevat stops and an alarm sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sits and watches the person type.

dialogues.speaker: INVESTIGATOR ONE
dialogues.text: Card please. Off SIMON’S LOOK we cut to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dejected, Simon treads heavily through the office while people clack away at their computers. Occasionally someon looks up and smirks in memory of last night’s events. Simon sits down at his desk. He rolls his eyes at Harris who is standing nearby. Simon looks past Harris and sees Papadopoulos walking closer and talking to a person obstructed from our view.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: We can really use a young man like you, especially right now with the big push and all. Papadopoulos has now moved into Simon’s field of vision, just a few cubicles in front of Simon. Simon stands up to get a better look at the new person, b his view is blocked. PAPADOPOULOS (CONT’D) I'd like to introduce everyone to our newest co-worker. A bright young man who I’m sure will be an asset. He asked to be moved here from our sister offices. Heard it was the best. Papadopoulos gives the man beside him a push in the ribs. Simon moves a few steps to the side but Harris is in his way. We get just a glimpse of the man.  31. Simon continues to move closer, as though he is compelled Quite a few of the other workers in the office have stood up as well, getting a look at the new employee. But now the new person has turned in the other direction. Simon waits for him to turn around, but as he does Papadopoulos again obstructs his view. PAPADOPOULOS (CONT’D) I’ll let you get started. Young hotshot, soon you'll have my job. Simon is now quite close to Papadopoulos, and only a few. paces away from the new man. Papadopoulos moves to the side, and for the first time we see the new worker. The man, JAMES, is the exact double of Simon. Simon and James are played by the same actor. Every physical attribute is identical, except Simon's clothes a slightly more worn. Simon gasps, his eyes wide and his, mouth agape. Simon continues to stare at James, who for the first time makes eye contact. James smiles at Simon, a strange half- friendly, half-threatening smile. PAPADOPOULOS (CONT’D) His name is James Simon. Simon lets out a high-pitched SQUEAL. Everyone in the office turns to Simon. He is embarrassed andysmiles sickly. Across from him James gives a little wink. Simon sways unsteady. His eyes roll and he tumbles backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon is on his back being fanned by Mr. Papadopoulos.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, my cleaner is a diabetic. We just need to jama cookie down his throat! Simon lifts himself up, looking around wildly.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: No, I’m not diabetic. What happened? Where is he?  32. He searches the faces around him but doesn’t see his double.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir, it’s just a shock that, well you know. The new man.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: (looking perturbed) Don’t worry son, we’re not replacing you. (beat) I’m not one of these holier than though types. Drugs can be healthy for a person, just leave it out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What, no, not drugs... Last night, a man I didn’t know...

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: No need for details, it’s happened to us all. Back to work. Papadopoulos reaches down and helps Simon up and sets him back at his desk. James returns and sits down opposite Simon. SIMON lets out another high pitched squeal. PAPADOPOULOS (CONT’D) I‘1l leave you to it. INT. SIMON’S CUBICLE - LATER Simon peers over his cubicle. He never takes his eyes off James. Simon runs his hands over his face. He is very flustered. Simon frantically searches around his desk. He finds a stapler and looks into the shiny metal bottom. We see his distorted reflection in the stapler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon drinks a glass of water to calm his nerves. He appears to be hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon has finished washing his face in front of a long mirror. He has calmed down and focuses on his breathing.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: It’s going to be okay. It’s just a resemblance. You’re just a little spooked, right?  33. Simon nods to himself slowly in the mirror. A flush comes from a bathroom stall. Simon looks embarrassed and turns to leave the bathroom. Simon tries to leave, the door to the stall swings open a James exits. They are now face to face, and time seems to slow. They carefully inspect one another; they are mirror images. They start to move again and begin to engage in that awkward dance one does when trying to get past someone. Simon and James both attempt to go to the left, then to t right. James gives Simon a friendly smile. Simon rushes from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon is hiding behind a door at the side ofthe office. He is watching James sitting at his desk. «Around James’ desk we see several other employees, including Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon remains in his hiding spot, watching James. Simon waits until he sees, Harris leave for the elevator. He quickly sidles up to Harris and grabs him by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris has two extremely large hot dogs in front of him. The restaurant is busy, but Simon doesn’t eat. Harris takes a huge bite of the hot dog and moans with pleasure. He gets ketchup on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Thanks for the dogs. You want a bite? Simon seems to be trembling.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Harris, the new worker here, he... (leaning in and whispering) You spoke to the new employee?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: James? Sure, I met him.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: And?  34.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Seems like an okay guy. Simon looks around to see if anyone is eavesdropping. Harris takes another bite of the hot dog.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Did you notice anything strange about him...I mean, did he remind you of anyone?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Well...I don't know. Not that I remember.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I mean...me, for instance? Harris thinks this over for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah...you know, now that you mention it...he does kind of remind me of you.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yes, but, what I mean is...

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah...you,know, you do look related. Almost like brothers. Simon grabs Harris' arm.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (in horror) We look related? You think so?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: (getting excited, louder) You do! It's true...I didn't realize at first. You look just like him! Or he looks just like you. It's incredible!

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: It is incredible! Why didn’t you notice?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know, you’re pretty, well, unnoticeable. But it’s a miracle. I met a man who had a moveable tailbone. But that’s nothing compared to this. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) It’s like, destiny.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: There’s no such thing. It’s an incredible coincidence, but... I mean, there are six billion people on the planet. A few are bound to look the same.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: (thinks) If you were Chinese, maybe I'd buy it. No, this is definitely something. You’1l probably end up wrestling at the top of a tall building before one of you falls to your doom. That’s normally how they end doppelganger movies. Or you were twins separated at birth. That often happens.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What’s he like?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: I don't know. He’s a guy. SIMON. Do you know why he. transferred?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: How should I know?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: But didn't they...do you know if they said anything about me?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: What is there to say about you? Simon opens his mouth and cocks his head. INT. SIMON’S CUBICLE - AFTERNOON Simon peeks cautiously over the top of his cubicle and watches James. James bobs his head while Simon looks at him mistrustfull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon walks into the enormous and empty elevator. He wait for the door to close. Just before the door closes James joins him.  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and James stand next to each other. Again the resemblance is incredible. Everything about them is the same. They both clear their throat at the same time, then simultaneously frown. James appears content, but Simon’s face shows his concern

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and James walk through the lobby. They walk stride for stride, as though mirror images.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and James step out of the door at the exact same ti and turn directly into each other. James, as though just deciding something, but still sure of himself, says

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Would you like to get a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES and SIMON run giggling from a bar. They howl down t street, kicking things over and laughing like children. INT. SIMON'S APARTMENT. NIGHT. Simon and James.stumble through the door, drunk. SIMON disappears off to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That was so much fun! Like when you said to that man ‘who are you looking at, friend?’ That was amazing! I would never do that. I mean, we were almost in a bar fight for god’s sake. ‘Who are you looking at? Friend.’ JAMES takes a look round the apartment. He strolls up to the telescope and looks through it. He sees Hannah's apartment. Hannah is curled up on her sofa watching THE S FI DETECTIVE SERIES on TV. He gives a look of recognition He hears the sound of SIMON returning and walks back to t centre of the room. SIMON has returned with one can of be and one glass.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I‘ll take the can.  INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS 37. SIMON and JAMES sit and finish their beer. They both seem pretty drunk.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: So what’s the action like round here?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Action?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah - in the office. That red haired girl who sits opposite us is a dirty, dirty thing. Simon laughs uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that french-sounding brunette with the red top and red nails. Maybe we should take them outs Which one do you want?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES,
dialogues.text: I prefer the french-sounding brunette, but either way.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (laughs ) No, that’s alright, you can. You can have both.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Never again. So, you got a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You a flamer?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: No. There’s someone I’ve been thinking about a lot.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Like some fantasy shit?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: No, she’s real. A person.  38.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Well, what’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I have all these things I want to say to her. He is sounding quite drunk now. The camera stays on him, moving closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like how I can tell she’s a lonely person - even if others can’t. Because I know what it is to be lonely and lost and invisible.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Simon, let me tell you something. I'll help you out with this. You have to go after what you want. I’d tear the asshole off an elephant for a piece of trim I wanted that bad.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I've tried talking to her but I don’t know how to be myself. It’s like I’m permanently outside myself. Like you,could push your hand straight through me if you wanted to. Simon looks at his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can see the type of man I want to be versus the type of man I actually am. (beat) I know that I’m doing it, but I’m incapable of doing what needs to be done. I’m like Pinnocchio. I’m a wooden boy, not a real boy. And it kills me. SIMON looks over and sees that JAMES has fallen asleep. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Simon puts a duvet around JAMES and a pillow under his head. Then gently Simon traces a line from Jame’s temple his chin with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I’m pleased we met.  39. Simon gets up, turns the light off and goes to bed. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT - MORNING Simon wakes up. He groggily gets out of bed and stumbles into the living area. JAMES is nowhere to be seen. In fact, there is no sign that he was there at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON is signing in at reception while people quickly swi in and bustle on to the elevators. A beaming JAMES appears.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s okay: he’s with me.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: No problem James. (to Simon) Just go right through. SIMON uneasily puts the pen down and follows James. JAMES seems to already be on friendly terms with a number of people in the building. He walks to the elevator greeting number of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and James exit the elevator. James is obviously doi the capper line to a joke. The people in the elevator all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What time did you get in?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I don’t know - about a half hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRIS approaches.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hey - did you get a chance to look at that report yet?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah - I left it on your desk.  40.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. Simon gives a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and James stand side by side together in the bathroom. Their shirts are off and their pants rest at their ankles. Simon looks very uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Somebody's going to come in.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Turn this way. Simon shifts and James looks amazed.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Exactly the same.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Down to the smallest freckle. James looks pointedly at Simon’s crotch.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I think mine is a bit bigger. Simon starts to disagree but just then we hear the toilet flush. Mr. Papadopoulos, emerges from a stall reading a newspape and buttoning up his pants. Simon frantically tries to pull up his boxers. James just stands there confidently.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: (not looking up from the paper) Keep up the good work boys. Papadopoulos exits the bathroom, leaving Simon scrambling with his shirt and James still nearly naked.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Jesus. I’m getting back to work. Simon starts to leave but James calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Wait! (beat) We're doing the switch right?  41.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I don’t know. What if they find out?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Look, I’m good with all this social stuff. You’re an awkward misfit, but you can help me out and take the test for me. (beat) We look the same and nobody will find out.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: But Papadopoulos put me in charge of his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, kids love me, and you don’t even like the little brat. (beat) You just take the test. I/’11 baby-sit for an hour.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Do you know anything about what we do here?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What’s to know?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Look, we’re a team, now. I’1ll help you, you help me. Like this girl, Hannah, you’ve got to take a step back. You can’t just stalk her. Chicks don’t dig stalkers. Unless they’re Sting in that song. Right? (Simon nods) Great. Within a week you’re going to get hand on boob. That’s a promise. Simon. Look at me. Within a week: hand on boob. Simon half laughs, half-shakes his head with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sits at James’ desk. He is working on a test.  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James sits at the same couch next to Melanie. Melanie, fa from being sullen is now effusive and interested.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: No, all of the boys in my school are so childish, so immature.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Nothing but a batch of raging hormones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon is finishing up the test. He looks at the clock and it is well after noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is sat much closer to Melanie. James talks near her ear.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You need to realize that data entry and collection and computers and stuff can be sensual. It has a romance. All these lives thatewe’re recording, their dreams, their hopes, their loves. Each person out there, apart, yet connected. We’re giving these faceless people immortality...

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Wow. He starts to stroke MELANIE’S earlobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon hands the test over to a secretary outside Mr. Papadopoulos’ office. She looks up at him and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Finished already?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: When do you think you’1l have the results?

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: For you? Right away. The secretary smiles at Simon. He is puzzled, unused to such treatment.  43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES is looking out of the window, checking that the coa is clear.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: Exactly. It’s like Daddy wanting me to go out on a date with his friend’s son. Like just because we're the same age doesn’t mean we have anything in common, right?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s no substitute for real emotional connection, that’s for certain. I’ve always felt emotional maturity is unrelated to material age. (Beat) You know, you have the most remarkable cleft in your chin.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: You think? JAMES closes the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES,
dialogues.text: I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sits at James’ desk while Mr. Papadopoulos stands over him excitedly. Simon doesn’t seem to be paying much attention, instead focusing on his empty desk.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: I knew we hired the right man, I just knew it.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Simon continues to wait for James to return. He is lookin at his empty desk.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: Where is the kid from that desk? He’s been here a while. Just between you and me he hasn’t impressed.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I’m sure there’s some explanation. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve found him to be quite competent. He’s probably doing something important.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: Sticking up for a co-worker, I like that, admirable. Papadopoulos waddles down the aisle of the office and Sim stands, looking back at his desk. James has suddenly appeared, sitting in Simon’s chair. He waves to Simon and rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (agitated) Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: How'd I do?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: You aced it. James claps his hands and does a spin.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I told you to be back an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Don’t worry! The old man is an idiot. We’re going to run this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and James are finishing up their lunch. James is eating an apple suggestively. In the distance we see he is making intense eye contact with Hannah. She looks up at him and then averts her eyes Simon is talking to James who is only half-listening.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: She's definitely looking at you.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What did I tell you? Just ignore them for a few days and they’1l come crawling.  45.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I do feel like she’s been looking at me a little.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Of course she has. That’s what you get when you listen to Captain Jim. (suddenly urgent) Look. She wants to come over. I’m going to hang back.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Just remember what we talked about. Play it cool. SIMON looks up. HANNAH is coming over to the table. JAMES scuttles away.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I sit here?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Sure. As in no. I don’t. Sit. Definitely. (beat, trying to be cool) I mean: it’s a free country. There’s an awkward silence for a while.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I’d really plucked up my courage to do this, but now... (laughs) Do you think we could maybe meet after work?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: It’s just I don’t want people round here to listen in on us. You know what it’s like in these buildings. Is there a place we could meet where we won’t have like work people around? We see JAMES looking on from a distance. Hannah leaves Simon’s table. He looks around and sees James. Simon smiles, James smiles back.  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON paces. He’s wearing a relatively smart jacket and looks like he’s taken a little more care with his appearance than usual. He sees Hannah approaching, castin a similar shadow to when Simon saw the Double after the Ball.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Nice spot here.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I like to watch people as they pass. It’s a good place to think.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, the fumes help with that. (beat) So: here’s the thing. I have this crush on someone.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: A crush?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: And this person on whom I have the crush doesn’t know that they’re the subject of my crush. (beat) And I'm pretty sure this person might have a crush on me too.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: How do you, know?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I’ve seen him looking at me.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: He works in my office. So I often notice him looking at me.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: And he seems to have moved right next to where I live.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: That could be a coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: It could be.  47.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Have you ever thought of telling him how you feel?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t dare.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: You should tell him.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: He just seems like one of those people who’s really popular.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Popular?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You know - everyone likes him - I imagine he has a lot of girls interested in him. He probably looks at everyone. SIMON blanches.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But, you seem close to him so I thought you might know what he thought.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Right. You mean James?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Oh God- is it that obvious? I don’t know what it is. I’ve never met anyone like him. Not that I've really met him. I think I’ve said hello to him maybe once.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: You've never met anyone like him?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Do you think you could find out if he is interested in me? God this is so dumb!

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: You really think he’s so unique? What exactly is so unique about him?  48.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Try to think.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: He has something.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: But you’ve never even spoken to him. How can you know if he has something?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You can tell by just looking at someone

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: By just looking at someone?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Yes. (beat) Listen - maybe it’s better if I just tell him.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Don’t do that. Look- I’11 tell him. If you want.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Sure. We're pretty close so... he listens to me.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks. Only if you’re comfortable with...

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Of course!

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I know it seems a little shallow of me...

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: No. Sorry I didn’t mean to pry Or...

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: No. Thanks... She's clearly forgotten his name.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Simon...

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Sorry! I’m just flustered. I’m... She hugs him. We see SIMON allow his face to relax into disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s great. There’s an awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God. This is so teenage... INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT - NIGHT SIMON lies on his couch, looking up at the ceiling. He suddenly rushes to the bathroom. INT. SIMON'S BATHROOM —- CONTINUOUS Simon vomits into the toilet. He stands up groggily and looks at himself in the mirror. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT. LIVING ROOM»- A LITTLE LATER SIMON looks through his, telescope at JAMES’ apartment. H is slumped on a chair playing a video game. He is greedil throwing popcorn into his,mouth. Below we look at Hannah’s apartment. She is drawing at he desk. She seems to,be happy, concentrating on her drawing A few feet away we see several drawings that she has made of James. Simon sighs and hangs his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon walks, defeated, next to James. Throughout this wal James passes various people who all acknowledge him, but not Simon.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Well I’m flattered, but she’s not really my type.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: She’s not your type?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: There’s something slightly tragic about her. Melanie on the other hand...  50.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Stay away from Melanie...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m only kidding. She’s underage anyway. Just.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I’m responsible for her. JAMES checks out a girl who walks past.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: This may not be such a bad thing anyway. I mean she’s obviously pretty shallow - she doesn’t even know me.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Why did I even tell you? They bump into HARRIS.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hey, have you got change for the machine?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS,
dialogues.text: Sure. I always keep change in my desk. Simon makes a face. They go to Harris's desk where there indeed a stash of change.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (picking up with Simon again) Because you’re a good person. I would have just gone as me. JAMES spots MELANIE across the office and winks at her.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But look, we have an arrangement. I‘1ll help you tonight, and you help me with the report for Papadopoulos. We’re making some real progress here. He should know your name soon. Off SIMON’S look we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and James walk along. Simon has his head down as though concentrating while James speaks like a professor, using plenty of hand motions.  51.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You need to have more of a swagger to your walk. If possible you want to kind of rotate your pelvis. (beat) It lets them know you have a full range of motion down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and James stand outside a restaurant watching as people walk in. James stares intensely into the eyes of a MODERATELY ATTRACTIVE WOMAN and licks his lips slightly. The woman looks at James as she enters the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (triumphant ) Did you see that? She was all over me.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: She was?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Of course. It’s because of my lip action. (beat) Show the tongue, but not like a lizard. You try. Another woman walks into the restaurant and Simon tries t lick his lip, but when he does so it somehow looks grotesque. The woman huffs into the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and James are again standing close to one another.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: When you’re standing next to them, or sitting, you want to put your hand on their lower back. See? James reaches out and puts his hand on Simon’s lower back

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not the ass, they sometimes get upset about that, but just above them. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It shows you’re interested and you could push them down the stairs at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Because you’ve got the leverage.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (confused) Here? Simon puts his hand on James lower back. James swats him away.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Stop that. It’s gay.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: You just did that to me.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But it was me: you see the difference? You can’t be doing anything gay. (beat) No ice cream cones.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I like ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Of course: it’s delicious. Ice cream is fine - in a cup - but a cone is gay, unless you’re with a woman at the time.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (confused, but going with it) Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No riding on a motorcycle with another man. (beat) The only exceptions are drive by shootings, purse snatching, or bomb throwing. Anything else is gay.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: You know a lot about this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Defense wins championships.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon and James again walking side by side.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You need to tell them how great you are, all the time. Which means you’1ll have to make things up.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What if they find out?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Make it hard to research. Like you were the captain of a Jai alai team in high school and a brigadier general in the navy with four confirmed kills. Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I don’t think anybody’d believe that.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Then change the subject, and deny everything.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I don’t know if this is me.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: How has being you worked? (beat) You understand everything I told you? Simon looks a bit overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Show me. Walk over to me and talk. Simon looks hesitant. Finally he starts walking toward James with a strange, over-pronounced swagger while licki his lips furiously. He looks ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Hello, there. I did three tours with the merchant marines. James smiles and nods at him proudly.  54.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: This just might work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON sits opposite HANNAH in a restaurant. He looks very uncomfortable. HANNAH shifts in her seat. It is silent for a long, long time.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're fucking this up. Say something. Just say something. Anything. How can you be fucking this up so badly? We see Hannah play with her food.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Hannah) I used to be an Olympic swimmer.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Go to the bathroom now.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON/JAMES goes into one,of the cubicles. JAMES is there waiting for him. He has a small radio transmitting device and headphones.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I can’t do this with you shouting in my ear. Simon takes an earpiece out of his ear, and starts removi a clip microphone from underneath his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Was your plan to spend the entire evening mute? I thought we'd planned this.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: She'd know I wasn’t you if I kept opening my mouth. Even when I said hello I saw her fill with doubt.  55.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Did you even jam your knee between her thigh like I suggested? (exasperated) This'd be going fine if you'd say what I tell you to.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Like that I want her well-lubed for later? I can’t say things like that.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That's why you live alone with a telescope. (beat) That was cruel. I’m sorry. It’s just I really want this to work out, and it’s frustrating me. Come on, let’s try again.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I’m not going back up there. You go.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? After what you've done? That's sending me to my death.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: We can find out what it is she likes,about you. Then I could try to be more like that on the next date if there’s a next date.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Fine. But I’m not wearing that thing. JAMES indicates the microphone/transmitter.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can watch. Isn’t that what you prefer?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: What’s that meant to mean?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m just messing with you.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I happen to have very serious feelings for this person.  56.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hey - I’m trying to help. Do you think I like spending my entire fucking evening in the toilet?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That's alright. Remember: we're helping each other out, okay? Give me your clothes. From now on we should always wear the same clothes. They start undressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES steps out, quickly followed by SIMON. A man washing his hands at the sink double takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Simon get to the door leading back into the restaurant. James peeks through it, but can’t see Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Did you move tables?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
