dialogues.text: No- Simon watches James walk into the restaurant and summon a waiter. The waiter points to the door. JAMES glances at Simon, then turns and runs. SIMON pokes his head out more, trying not to be seen. We see HANNAH collecting her coat by the front desk, on h way out. She leaves just before JAMES gets there. JAMES runs over and follows her out of the restaurant. Simon creeps out from behind the door, still nervous of being discovered. He can see HANNAH and James engaged in a heated row outside. It is raining, and Hannah’s starting to get drenched. JAMES offers his coat, but she rejects it. Hannah turns to leave, but James pulls her back to him. S slaps his face, then he slaps hers. She looks completely shocked. She starts to cry.  57. James hugs her. Hannah punches him from within the hug. James leans in to kiss her, Hannah struggles before seemi to submit completely. The table at the front of the restaurant breaks out into spontaneous applause. We see Hannah and James look back i through the window, shy and coquettish, give an ironic bo and skip off into the night. We stay on Simon, perplexed and breathless. As he gathers his wits and makes to follow, another waiter brings him t cheque for the meal. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT BLOCK - NIGHT SIMON hurtles up the stairs to his apartment. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS He dashes over to the telescope and points it at HANNAH'S APARTMENT, but the blinds, for the first time, are closed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon waits for, JAMES. He’s still angry and is half-paci When he finally sees him, he bounds over to intercept.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: James! James ignores him, swipes in using his card, skips throug the» lobby”“and catches the elevator, just as the door is closing. He gives Simon a wink.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (to Simon) Visitors need to sign in.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (frustrated) I’m not a visitor. He starts filling out the form, Simon looks up and sees Hannah, a dreamy look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hannah! Wait up! But she’s gone.  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON watches HANNAH from afar. She seems very happy. He approaches the desk, holding a few sheets of A4. Again Liz is there to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Hi. I know the policy, but my printer’s actually broken.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Hannah! That creepy guy’s here again. Hannah comes over, still in a good mood.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Hi, creepy guy.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON

dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.text: I'm just putting a cover on them.

dialogues.text: (more insistent) No. Really, it's,okay. I can do it. Papadopoulos is really staring now. Simon stops, hesitant to make a scene in front of Papadopoulos. dialogues.text: Great work, James. It's good to see you at it already. That's the kind of initiative I like.

dialogues.text: Simon stands a few feet away from his seated mother. His mother looks very bad, pale and thin, much worse than whe we first saw him.  65. A few feet away the gypsy woman is looking at him.

dialogues.text: Mother, is it possible? Did I have a twin? She doesn’t respond.

dialogues.text: This used to be my favorite song.

dialogues.text: There’s no song playing. And besides, you hate music.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: You know, I’m busy.

dialogues.text: Like a stroke!

dialogues.text: We prefer to call them cerebral incidents. They happen all the time. (MORE )

dialogues.text: Le Mark! Simon turns around, surprised again by the woman.

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: You have the mark. I see it in you. You’re half a man. (beat) A person cannot be two, but one. (hissing) You must cut him out!

dialogues.text: You are talking about him, aren't you? She leans forward and taking something from beneath her blankets she hands it to Simon.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do I do? Won’t you tell me? The woman _turns away and we hear a clattering from Simon mother. He “looks at her, then down at his hands. The woman has given him a bone-handled knife. On the bottom we see a carved image of two snakes, each in the act of consuming the other.

SIMON’S APARTMENT - EVENING Simon is studying James’s apartment through his telescope He has been doing this for some time. There is no one there. Briefly, he tilts down to Hannah’s apartment. Hannah's watching the Sci-Fi show on TV, but occasionally she gets up and paces about. She seems agitated. On her walls we see several more pictures that Hannah has drawn of James. dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.text: And) I want you tell Papadopoulos that I’ve been doing all of your work since you got here. PAUSE.

dialogues.text: Simon? Simon is taken off guard, surprised to see Hannah in his domain. She looks upset and nervous.

dialogues.text: Which I know and always have known, but to be made a fool of by... SIMON. A villain. It’s not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.text: Er... Nothing. Sorry.

dialogues.text: You need to shape up, Stanley. I want to see some real work from you.

dialogues.text: Actually I’m working on something at the moment - something I think could help efficiency in the way=

dialogues.text: Come on. I’m not in the mood

dialogues.text: I arranged to see Melanie tonight. (beat) I’m outside now because I have to sneak her in the service entrance so the doorman doesn’t us.  77.

dialogues.text: You’re a snake. She shakes her head and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over music, we see SIMON wandering around the city at night. He goes to the Bridge. He has a coffee in a diner. He sits at a bench. An old, frightening looking man sits next to him. Simon gets up. He tries to sleep in a doorway but is moved on by a policeman

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon turns up at work, and signs in looking totally dishevelled. Hannah walks by him with a look of contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon’s at his desk, staring, crushed with tiredness. He sees JAMES and MELANIE flirting outside his office. Sh laughs loudly at his jokes and leans provocatively agains the door. EXT. VARIOUS —- NIGHT Simon walks through the city. At one point his shadow briefly seems like it’s moving independently of him. He turns round and sees the frightening man who sat next to him»on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, out of habit, looks through the dumpster outside o Hannah’s apartment. Simon frantically pieces a few torn up strips of paper together. They are pictures of James, but somehow this ti they look more like Simon. EXT. SIMON’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Simon watches Hannah enter her apartment from near the entrance to his. We see he wants to talk to her but holds back. She turns and sees him, she looks up to his apartment, she sees JAMES walk to the window, he has no t on, MELANIE approaches him and nuzzles his neck. She looks back at Simon.  78. She walks over to Simon and slaps him hard on the face.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (hesitant) I’m sorry, I haven’t done anything.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You haven't, have you? You don’t do anything. Simon doesn’t say anything and Hannah turns, going back t her apartment. Simon puts his hand to his face. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT DOOR - NIGHT Simon bangs on the door. There’s no answer. We just hear giggling. He bangs on the door again. JAMES opens the door, brandishing a._knife. He launches a Simon, knocking him to the ground. James straddles him an runs the knife along Simon’s face.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES,
dialogues.text: What did I tell you? What did I tell you about disturbing me? Simon is terrified. He looks closely at the knife - with disbelief. On the bottom we see carved a picture of a sna eating another snake.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Where did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What’s yours is mine.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: None of it’s yours.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You want it back? James rests the knife on Simon’s Adam’s apple and gives i a quick flick. It starts to bleed.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have it. He throws the knife down next to Simon.  79.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, take care of yourself, we're in this together. James slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh - that James idiot... Simon touches his neck and looks at the blood on his hand He looks at the knife on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon walks down the street late at night. Many people ar out, drunken and loud. He has been drinking, and looks a little unsteady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon seems to be walking in a world of shadows. He hums quietly to himself and we hear footsteps behind him.

dialogues.speaker: VAGRANT
dialogues.text: You have a cigarette? Simon turns and sees three dirty looking men following hi They seem ominous.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I don’t smoke.

dialogues.speaker: VAGRANT
dialogues.text: You lying?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Simon, drunk, seems to smile to himself as the men descen on him. They hit him and Simon collapses in a heap. They begin to kick at him and hit him in the face. Simon almost seems to smile, as though he is floating out of his body.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Stop it, I know this guy. The men mutter and move away. Simon is helped to his feet we're not sure by whom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon is sitting with the frightening man. It’s clear tha they're familiar with one another now, almost friends.  80. Simon has bought some food for them both. His face is marked up with dried blood. They eat side by side.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGHTENING MAN
dialogues.text: In Russia we have a story. Two snakes are born, brothers. After a few months they grow and they shake the skin off so they can grow bigger. One snake he says it hurts too bad. So he’s not going to eat no more. Just enough to live, so he doesn’t have to get a new skin. The other snake, he eats everything, he wants to get bigger, so he eats everything he can, and he grows strong.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: And what happens? To the snakes?

dialogues.speaker: FRIGHTENING MAN
dialogues.text: The big snake, he eats his brother, the one who doesn’t grow. He becomes the biggest snake. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT BLOCK - LATER Simon tries to sleep in the stairwell of his apartment block. He is woken up by seeing MELANIE and JAMES leave. collects the key from above the apartment door. He looks around his apartment - it’s a mess. Stuck betwee the frame and the mattress, Simon finds a pair of handcuffs. He picks them up and stares at them. He places them, along with the snake-handled knife, in the drawer next to his bed. To his disbelief, there’s ANOTHER snake- handled knife already in the drawer. He clears up some of the stuff lying around. He goes to t bathroom and sees the mark on his neck, it’s ugly and bruised. He cleans it and covers it with a plaster. The rest of Simon’s face is bruised as well, including a dark and ugly black eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, his face bruised and battered walks through the lobby. He’s stopped by a guard.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Over here.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I know, I have to sign the guest book.  81.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Simon James.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: I thought, so, you’re wanted in worker services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon sits across from a man with a tiny bow-tie. The man smacks his gum.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE WORKER
dialogues.text: You don’t exist anymore.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE WORKER
dialogues.text: You're no longer in the system: You're gone.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I work here. I am sitting in this chair, am I not?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE WORKER
dialogues.text: I smell you.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (seething) I’ve had»some problems with my apartment. (beat) Put me back into the system.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE WORKER
dialogues.text: I can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE WORKER
dialogues.text: Doesn’t work like that. You either exist, or you don’t. (beat) You’re welcome to carry on working here, it’s just we won't be able to pay you anymore. INT. SIMON’S CUBICLE - DAY Simon hasn’t even looked through the papers piled at his desk, instead keeping his eyes solely focused on James’ desk. It is empty.  82.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: You alright, buddy? Simon jumps to attention.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks Harris.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: It’s got to be tough on you.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah I guess it is.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: I got this book for you. Harris hands Simon a book whose title is, ‘Conquering Substance Abuse.’

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: James told us about your...problems.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Thanks Harris. But I don’t...

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS,
dialogues.text: You're welcome..You need to finish it in the next week though, it’s only returnable through Friday.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: I was gonna ask you... But this might not be the best time.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks bud. If you could have it ready by tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Fine. I don’t like you at all, but you’re the only thing close to a friend that I have here.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: I feel the same way about you. I just need to warn you though, I think you're like, on some kind of probation. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know: you’ve been showing up late, smelling kind of bad.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Where is James? Simon starts to walk back towards his desk.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: I think he’s in his office now.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: He has an office?

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, Papadopoulos is pretty impressed with him. Apparently he’s written this incredible report on how to increase efficiency in the department. Simon doesn’t even change expression.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey: do you know what regression analysis is? EXT. JAMES’ OFFICE - A LITTLE LATER James, indeed has a new office. Simon storms past the secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon opens the door. An irritated secretary is behind hi

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Mr Simon is in an important meeting... James, leaning on the edge of an enormous desk, is finishing telling a joke. He seems extremely comfortable. Three or four people from the department are there, as we as Papadopolous and Mr. Stevens.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: So two Chinese virgins get married right? And it’s the night of the wedding and they just finished boning. The other workers chuckle, anticipating a joke.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And the husband says. That was great, is there anything you’d like to try? And the woman says...  84. Simon approaches, looking pale as a sheet. He notices tha James has a plaster on his Adam’s apple: it looks exactly the same as Simon’s. He also has a black eye, the same as Simon's.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Mr. Papadopolous...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hold on a sec. The woman says, I'd like to try a number sixty nine. (beat) And the guy thinks for a second, and he says, “You want Breef wiff Broccori?!" James roars with laughter and the other workers laugh as well.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Sir, I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I work here.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: You have,a lot of nerve. Simon points at James.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: This man is a fraud!

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: You should talk! He’s the finest new employee we’ve ever had.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: He doesn’t even know what we do here! They turn to James who remains calm.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (shrugging, confident) Oh, you know. This and that...

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: See there, calm down, son.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: He’s an idiot!  85.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sir, why don’t I help him out, he seems like he’s...

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Stay away from me. Sir, this can’t stand. SIMON notices JAMES’ eye, and the bruise, which looks identical to his.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’d you get that?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Racketball. Hell of a sport, you should try it, relieves stress.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: Son, I think you might be having a psychotic...

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I took his test for him. And he ripped off my report. He’s out to get me! He stole my face! People exchange glances as though Simon is crazy. Simon points at his face. He is wide-eyed and on the edge

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He stole it from me! For the first time,Simon has really lost it, really out o control. His mild manner is gone. The whole room watches him. James walks forward and grabs Simon’s arm. Simon tears it away from him.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get off of me.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: You need to leave, now.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (backing away from everyone) I need... (catching breath) To see the Colonel. Simon seems to be losing steam, getting dizzy.  86.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Colonel will understand. (breathing heavy) I just need to see him.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: Son, you need some help. We see JAMES press a button underneath his desk.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I don’t need help!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: We all love you, Simon. There is a big scrum, a wild fight, Simon swings wildly. Somehow he manages to separate himself, and we see he has somehow grabbed hold of Mr. Stevens’ hand. Two security guards have now arrived.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Please come with me, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: No. He holds it out in a threatening manner. As though it wer a gun. His hand shakes.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay back.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD 2
dialogues.text: Sir, you need to come with us. Simon runs at JAMES again but his arms are pinned by the security guards. They hold him down on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: PAPADOPOULOS
dialogues.text: You're a disgrace to the Colonel, son! JAMES walks up to Simon with menace, crouches and whisper in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Your time is over, Simon. The guards grab Simon by the arms and Simon does not protest as they lead him from the office.  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON is sitting on the edge of the bridge where he likes to think. He has his small cardboard box on his lap. He looks up at the monumental office buildings around him and the cars rushing by below. INT. ELEVATOR IN SIMON’S APARTMENT Simon RIDES the elevator, holding his small box of office possessions. INT./EXT. SIMON’S APARTMENT Simon retrieves his key from the top of the door sill and wearily walks in. The place is disgusting: a feral den. There are empty bottles and take away cartons on the floor alongside a pa of soiled latex gloves. The bed has been dragged to the middle of the room and ha a pair of handcuffs attached to it. There is a video camera trained on a high tripod above th bed linked to the television which, in turn, shows the somehow frightening image,of the bed. Simon switches the camera off. The television then shows a the SCI-FI SHOW.

dialogues.speaker: SCI-FI DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Ruins. This World is Ruins. Simon switches off the television. Simon clears up the room and throws out various bits of trash. When he’s finished, the room is almost completely bare. He checks his phone messages. Nothing. He takes the handcuffs from the bed and pauses a moment before placing them in a drawer by the bed. The same draw that now contains the snake-handled knives. He sits down at a table and starts to write. We see the start of the note ‘To whom it may concern. I have decided to end my life because I no longer exist. A person should amount to something and not float around this earth like a ghost.’ pauses for thought. He screws up the note and starts agai ‘To whom it may concern. I am a ghost.’  88. He then adds. ‘I am sorry.’ He folds up the note, places it in his top pocket and wal to the window. He opens it and starts to climb out onto t ledge when he sees something. He almost falls, but manage to stumble back inside. He hurriedly locates his telescop and peers through. We see Hannah lying on the floor of her apartment, completely inert. Simon pans and we see an empty bottle o pills just by her out stretched hand. SIMON puts his hand to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah rests on a gurney. She is being wheeled quickly do the hallway of a hospital. There is vomit on her top and she seems to be in some pain. Simon is running along side trying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Is she going to be okay? I don’t know how many she swallowed.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You need to leave now, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: We're married!

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Please, sir. We’ll take good care of her. SIMON reluctantly stops running and watches Hannah and th medics disappear through some double doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON is sitting in a waiting room. A doctor comes in. SIMON looks up. INT. HOSPITAL —- CORRIDOR

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Has she done this kind of thing before?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: No. I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I'm afraid to say she’s had a miscarriage. (beat)  89.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Was this your first pregnancy?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Erm... yes.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: The good thing is, she’s healthy. You've plenty of time to try again. How long have you been married?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Not long. We’re about to be. We're engaged. But I just lost my job so - I couldn't buy her a ring - and we had this fight so -

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Look after her.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I will. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You’11 work it out. INT. HANNAH’S APARTMENT BLOCK SIMON and a GROGGY-LOOKING HANNAH travel up in the lift together. INT. HANNAH’S APARTMENT -— CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Thanks for letting me stay. I've been kind of sleeping rough since... for a while anyway. He trails off.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re normally gone by the morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah is under the covers. SIMON tentatively gets on to the bed and lies on top of the duvet, as far from HANNAH he can be without falling off the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON wakes up. He checks on Hannah - she’s still sleeping.  90. He creeps out of Hannah’s room and into the sitting room, unable to believe he’s there. He searches in his bag and fishes out a book. He places it next to Hannah. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT BLOCK - LATER Simon rides the lift up to his apartment. He almost looks happy. INT. HANNAH’S BEDROOM - DAY HANNAH wakes up and sees a book on the pillow next to her It’s the book that Simon left. She opens it and sees it contains the various pictures that she’d drawn, torn up a threw away. They have been carefully put back together again. In between one of the pages is a note written by Simon. It says: ‘I think these are really good - Simons” INT. SIMON’'S APARTMENT - DAY Again, it’s a mess. But this time, Simon doesn’t seem to mind as much. He checks his messages. We hear a voice.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Er, hi. This is.a message for Simon. We’ve been trying you for some time now. If you wish to attend your mother’s funeral it starts at 1l.am at the citizen’s cemetery to the rear of the home. Goodbye. Then a beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon runs through an enormous cemetery. It is remarkably ungreen and surrounded by huge buildings. He looks around, frantic, trying to find where the funera is being held. He approaches one grouping that looks like it could be fo his mother, all the people in attendance are quite old. A priest is quietly saying a prayer and everyone’s eyes are downcast. Unable to ask who this is for, he joins the gro and clasps his hands in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: ...-He maketh me to lie down in green pastures; He leadeth me beside the still waters. He restoreth my soul; (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for His name's sake. Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for Thou art with me; Thy rod and Thy staff, they comfort me. Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies; Simon looks up, past the priest.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over. Far in the distance, impossibly, he sees James and standing next to another priest. Along with two or people from the old people’s home. James is putting soil on to the coffin. An old man Napoleon hat is consoling him.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, and I will... Simon, as angry as we've seen him, hurtles towards

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...dwell in the house of the Lord forever. We watch at a distance, as events unfold with grim inevitability. James ‘sees Simon approach and starts to back away.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: This is the crazy guy Simon told us about?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Look: I can get you help- but this is a time for family.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing here? His mother’s just died! Simon launches at JAMES. Unlike in the office, the Melanie three ina them. old people assembled are unable to prise them apart. Simon lands a great punch, right on James’s NOSE. James throws his head back and squeals with pain. He drops to his knee  92.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Get up... Get up off your knees. For a brief moment, Simon looks heroic, but then he notic his nose is bleeding. He checks it with his hand, and loo a the blood on his fingers Then, a strangely demented scream. It’s the (very old) priest running towards him. Simon backs away, but the priest manages to push him over and Simon falls backward into a freshly dug grave. On the verge of consciousness, staring straight up at the sky, Simon sees the small congregation assemble at the grave’s perimeter. As James looks over the grave, a drop of blood falls from his nose and splashes on to Simon's face.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Thank God mother didn’t live to see this. Melanie spits. Simon blacks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now dusk. Simon wakes up. He feels a great pain at the front of his face. He touche his nose - it’s agony. He sits up and feels something dripping from this nose. H puts his hand tovshis face and his fingers become sticky with blood. We “see him think. He smiles. We cut to Simon climbing out of the grave, an absolute mess, looking half-crazy. He runs up to a parked hearse and looks at his reflection in the black mirror. He looks at his bruised nose with delight, checking it from all angles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon runs. His face is smeared with blood. He is dirty from the grave. He has a strangely joyous look on his fac  93. He runs and runs until he reaches the apartment complex where he lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIMON runs in through the lobby and the janitor looks at him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: Who are you going to see?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: (happy) Oh, sorry James, didn’t recognize you at first. INT. — HANNAH'S APARTMENT SIMON runs up to the door and rings the bell. HANNAH open the door. She is taken aback by how dishevelled-he is. Simon grabs her and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: That’s all I ever wanted ‘to do. It’s funny how it happens isn’t it? You go along, and along, and along and then you just know. (Hannah, looks shocked) I noticed you the first moment I saw you.,And you recognized me too, didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I don’t want to be a boy held up by string. I don’t want to be Pinocchio.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Simon, what happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I want you to be safe and whole and right. But I have something to do. (beat, firm) From now on you're going to need to call me James. I’11 still be Simon, but you need to call me James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her again.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goodbye. Simon turns around abruptly and leaves Hannah speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see SIMON walking briskly to his apartment block. He looks back at HANNAH’S APARTMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah looks out of her window at SIMON. INT. SIMON’S APARTMENT Gently, Simon opens the door. In the dim light he can see James and Melanie sleeping on his bed. Simon quietly locates JAMES’ trousers and takes JAMES’ APARTMENT KEY and IDENTITY CARD. He finds his TUXEDO and silent changes into it. He puts t keys and card into his pocket. He approaches the bed and inches open the drawer in the bedside table. In it are the snake-handled knives and the pair of handcuffs. He removes the handcuffs. Carefully, he locks James’ hand to the bed head. He picks up one of the knives and runs the tip of it very near, but not touching, James’ face before placing its ti on James’ throat. He looks at JAMES’S SWOLLEN nose. In a quick move he removes the plaster on James’s Adam's apple. Underneath, is the same ugly pick gash as Simon ha on his. The phone rings James stirs. Simon rushes over and picks up. He is still holding the knife.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (whisper) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s Hannah. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (whisper) I’m okay.  95.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You left kind of abruptly. Can I come over?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (whisper) Not right now

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You're not going to do something stupid —-

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. Stay in your apartment. He hangs up the phone and walks over to James, holding th knife. He looks down at him. INT.
